org.corfudb.runtime.stream

Interface ILog

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleLog

    public interface ILog
    This interface represents an append-only stream. The basic operations of an append-only stream are: append, which places a new entry at the tail of the stream read, which allows for random reads trim, which trims a prefix of the stream, exclusive Created by mwei on 4/30/15.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ITimestamp append(Serializable data)
      Appends data to the tail (end) of the log.
      Object read(ITimestamp address)
      Reads data from an address in the log.
      void trim(ITimestamp address)
      Trims a prefix of the log, [0, address) exclusive.

    • Method Detail

      • append

        ITimestamp append(Serializable data)
           throws OutOfSpaceException
        Appends data to the tail (end) of the log.
        Parameters:
        data - The object to append to tail of the log.
        Returns:
        A timestamp representing the address the data was written to.
        Throws:
        OutOfSpaceException - If there is no space remaining on the log.

      • read

        Object read(ITimestamp address)
     throws UnwrittenException,
            TrimmedException,
            ClassNotFoundException,
            IOException
        Reads data from an address in the log.
        Parameters:
        address - A timestamp representing the location to read from.
        Returns:
        The object at that address.
        Throws:
        UnwrittenException - If the address was unwritten.
        TrimmedException - If the address has been trimmed.
        ClassNotFoundException
        IOException

      • trim

        void trim(ITimestamp address)
        Trims a prefix of the log, [0, address) exclusive.
        Parameters:
        address - A timestamp representing the location to trim.
